alert.note: Alert for Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 6:41AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and/or snowmelt and/or ice jam is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Vermont, including the town of Woodstock in Windsor County. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 637 AM EST, Local law enforcement reported localized high water on US Route 4 East in Woodstock along the Ottauquechee River due to an ice jam. The road currently remains open, but rapid fluctuations in water are possible this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Woodstock and West Woodstock. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Obey all road closure signs. They are there for your safety.
